snippet: A better-than-expected finish at a tournament last month has chess experts questioning how they can better monitor players’ performance.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column; better-than-expected finish at tournament in Zadar, Croatia, has chess experts questioning how they can better monitor players’ performance.
lead_paragraph: A better-than-expected finish at a tournament last month has chess experts questioning how they can better monitor players’ performance.

headline.print_headline: A Quandary for the Game In a High-Tech Era
headline.seo: Chess: Borislav Ivanov’s Performance Is Scrutinized
